Sentencas: Gadolinia-doped ceria (GDC), as an electrolyte of solid oxide fuel cells, reduces its mechanical property when exposed to reducing conditions.
Titulo: Atomistic simulations of anisotropic mechanical behavior in non-stoichiometric gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes

Sentencas: In this paper, the anisotropic mechanical behavior of non-stoichiometric GDC solid electrolytes is investigated by using the molecular dynamics (MD) method.
Titulo: Atomistic simulations of anisotropic mechanical behavior in non-stoichiometric gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes

Sentencas: It is found that the oxygen vacancies whether from doping Gd3+ ions or generating Ce3+ ions by reduction have a serious impact on the mechanical properties such as phase transformation and fracture strength.
Titulo: Atomistic simulations of anisotropic mechanical behavior in non-stoichiometric gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes

Sentencas: The defect-dependent tensile strength is observed to be consistent with reported experimental measurements.
Titulo: Atomistic simulations of anisotropic mechanical behavior in non-stoichiometric gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes

Sentencas: Moreover, increasing temperature reduces the fracture strength.
Titulo: Atomistic simulations of anisotropic mechanical behavior in non-stoichiometric gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes

Sentencas: The influence of temperature on the critical nucleation stress and the fluorite phase strength is further analyzed.
Titulo: Atomistic simulations of anisotropic mechanical behavior in non-stoichiometric gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes

Sentencas: Beyond that, GDC undergoes volumetric expansion due to non-stoichiometric effects.
Titulo: Atomistic simulations of anisotropic mechanical behavior in non-stoichiometric gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes

Sentencas: The linear chemical strain and coefficient of compositional expansion (CCE) are calculated and compared with the experimental results.
Titulo: Atomistic simulations of anisotropic mechanical behavior in non-stoichiometric gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes
